programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Owls (2-2, 0-0 American) and Golden Hurricane (2-2, 0-0) begin league play. Tulsa has won back-to-back meetings with Temple to take a 4-3 lead in the all-time series. Temple's E.J. Warner has thrown for 1,000 yards and five TDs this year.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Owls (2-2, 0-0 American) and Golden Hurricane (2-2, 0-0) begin league play. Tulsa has won back-to-back meetings with Temple to take a 4-3 lead in the all-time series. Temple's E.J. Warner has thrown for 1,000 yards and five TDs this year.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cardinals visit the Wolfpack. Louisville (4-0, 2-0 ACC) leads the all-time series with NC State (3-1, 1-0) by an 8-4 margin after a 25-10 decision in 2022. Cardinals receiver Jamari Thrash has turned 19 catches into 400 yards and five touchdowns.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Bearcats (2-2, 0-1) and Cougars (3-1, 0-1) seek their first conference wins as Big 12 members. BYU won both previous meetings with Cincinnati in 2015 and 2016. On Sept. 23, Cincinnati fell to then-No. 16 Oklahoma, while BYU lost against Kansas.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 22 Gators (3-1, 1-0 SEC) run up against the Wildcats (4-0, 1-0) in a Week 5 clash. Florida has won three in a row after defeating Charlotte 22-7 on Sept. 23. Kentucky has won two straight meetings after knocking off Florida 26-16 last year.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 13 Tigers visit the No. 20 Rebels. LSU has scored 147 points during a three-game win streak, with senior quarterback Jayden Daniels accounting for 13 TDs in those contests. Ole Miss' three-game run ended with a loss to then-No. 13 Alabama.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 12 Crimson Tide seek their 16th straight victory over the SEC foe Bulldogs. Mississippi State last beat Alabama in 2007. Bama rebuffed then-No. 15 Ole Miss 24-10 in Week 4. Jo'Quavious Marks (MSST) has rushed for 352 yards and four scores.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 13 Tigers visit the No. 20 Rebels. LSU has scored 147 points during a three-game win streak, with senior quarterback Jayden Daniels accounting for 13 TDs in those contests. Ole Miss' three-game run ended with a loss to then-No. 13 Alabama.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: Kickoff
programme.desc: Football pregame show.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: A look at the moments that drove sports bettors wild during recent games.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.desc: Action from high school football.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Showcasing the best fights from recent events, revealing backstories of the athletes and their mindsets.

programme.title: PFL 2023 Best of the Playoffs
programme.desc: Highlights from the Professional Fighters League playoffs.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: Memorable knock-outs from throughout MMA history.

programme.desc: Demetrious Johnson takes on Henry Cejudo at UFC 227, August 4, 2018.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: Fantasy Focus
programme.desc: Field Yates hosts ESPN's top Fantasy Football experts for a daily discussion of rankings, injuries and game previews and debate how the biggest NFL stories impact Fantasy Football.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: WNBA news, analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Mohegan Sun Arena hosts Game 3 of this semifinal between New York and Connecticut. Breanna Stewart, who was named WNBA MVP for the second time prior to Game 2, chipped in with a double-double and five blocks in the Liberty's 84-77 series-tying win.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Aces try to book a spot in the WNBA Finals as they visit the Wings for Game 3. A'ja Wilson posted 30 points and 11 rebounds in a 91-84 win over Dallas on Sept. 26, helping Las Vegas to a 2-0 series lead. Arike Ogunbowale scored 24 for the Wings.

programme.title: One More Round: Hagler vs. Hearns
programme.desc: Another look at the fight between Marvin Hagler and Thomas Hearns, which has become known as "The War." From Aug. 15, 1985.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Blazers try to turn the tide in their American Athletic Conference debut against the Green Wave. Jacob Zeno has accounted for 11 of UAB's 16 touchdowns in 2023. Tulane has won two in a row after dismantling Nicholls State 36-7 on Sept. 23.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers (3-1, 1-0 American) match up with the Broncos (2-2, 1-0 MWC) for the first time. Memphis took its first loss of the season in Week 4, a 34-27 decision against Missouri in St. Louis. Boise State looks to pick up a third straight victory.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Three-game win streaks clash as the Horned Frogs (3-1, 1-0 Big 12) host the Mountaineers (3-1, 1-0). TCU's 41-31 win in 2022 cut West Virginia's lead in the all-time series to 7-5. Savion Williams had 97 receiving yards and a TD for TCU in that game.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: We're #1! The Story of 1999 Florida State Football
programme.desc: A look at the Seminoles' undefeated BCS National Championship team that went wire-to-wire as college football's No. 1 team during the 1999 season.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Filmmaker Billy Corben documents the rise to prominence of the college football program at the University of Miami.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The University of Miami's football program tries to recover from the devastation left by NCAA sanctions and scandals.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.desc: The No. 10 Utes ride a stout defense into their Pac-12 test against the No. 19 Beavers. The series is tied 12-12-1 after Utah won 42-16 in 2022. The Utes are yielding 9.5 points per game, sixth-fewest nationally, after beating then-No. 22 UCLA 14-7.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Knights (3-1, 0-1) try for their first Big 12 victory as they host the Bears (1-3, 0-1). UCF saw its three-game winning streak halted in its conference debut Sept. 23, a 44-31 loss at Kansas State. Baylor plays its first road contest of 2023.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Iowa State (2-2, 1-0 Big 12) looks to slow down Dillon Gabriel and No. 14 Oklahoma (4-0, 1-0). Gabriel has completed 78% of his passes for 1,227 yards and 12 touchdowns in the Sooners' first four games. Oklahoma leads the all-time series 79-7-2.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Mountain West combatants kick off conference play as the unbeaten Bulldogs host the winless Wolf Pack in Week 5. Fresno State has won 13 in a row dating back to Week 7 of last season, including a 41-14 result against Nevada on Nov. 19, 2022.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 8 Trojans try to stay perfect against the Buffaloes. USC has won all 16 meetings, averaging 39.9 points in 11 Pac-12 get-togethers. Colorado comes off its first loss in the Deion Sanders era, a 42-6 shellacking at then-No. 10 Oregon.
